sortTitle: differentiated protection for priority accounts in microsoft defender for office 365: focusing on your most visible and targeted users
description: It’s never been more critical to ensure that all your users are secure, but it’s even more important that your most visible, most targeted, and most vulnerable employees are under a watchful protective eye. sortTitle: working from home - how are other people doing it? (we/emea table talk)
description: European, Middle East and Africa Table Talk: Working from home sounds awesome right? No commute, your choice of pants - but we now know it's not all fun. The good thing is you're not alone! Meet and share stories with fellow attendees in this scheduled Microsoft Teams meeting. Unmute yourself, turn your camera on - No presentations here! Your community peers will lead a discussion so we can all find out how the community are staying connected with colleagues, adjusting management styles and work-life balance while working remotely. Let's talk about some of the options available to you, and how you can begin to see what's going on with your devices.

title: Working from home - How are other people doing it? (Americas Table Talk)
sortTitle: working from home - how are other people doing it? (americas table talk)
description: Americas Table Talk: Working from home sounds awesome right? No commute, your choice of pants - but we now know it's not all fun. You might not have the right office setup, distractions and interruptions affecting your meetings, the added responsibility of home schooling, lack of human interaction, building anxiety, these are things we didn't expect to deal with in 2020. -Protect Azure production workloads

title: How to be a Social Technologist in a Virtual World
sortTitle: how to be a social technologist in a virtual world
description: We hear a lot about the skills required to be a technologist – we endlessly tweak our LinkedIn profiles, try to build a social presence and highlight our best “human” skills, but how do you do that in a fully virtual world in the midst of an ongoing global pandemic? What does it take to be a social technologist in this new normal? Are you visible online, and an even better question - should you be? How do you show up on virtual Teams meetings or events? We cover GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, StackOverflow, Blogging, Podcasting etc and share tips on setting up your own webcam and home AV equipment (Spoiler alert: It doesn’t have to be fancy!) as we aim to understand what a well-rounded technologist looks like today’s virtual world. We also cover staying safe (and sane!) online, being both appropriately private and public, and how to be authentic while not giving away too many personal things.

title: Mentoring Future Technologists: HBCU Students get Real
sortTitle: mentoring future technologists: hbcu students get real
description: Today’s budding technologists in colleges and universities around the world will soon become tomorrow’s tech professionals and developers. Did you know Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCU) produce 47% of all Black women engineers, 40% of all Black engineers and 27% of all Black STEM graduates despite representing only 3% of all US colleges? Join us in this session to hear from our Microsoft Ignite Humans of IT Student Ambassadors from five HBCUs to hear about how they discovered their passion in technology, their personal development journey and their goals to transform the future of tech. Gain insights on what students from underrepresented communities are looking for in their future tech employers, and how tech professionals like you can help support their growth.

The good thing is you're not alone! Meet and share stories with fellow attendees in this scheduled Microsoft Teams meeting. Unmute yourself, turn your camera on - No presentations here!
